justification-for-inclusion: This parameter is similar to _clisccp_, the existing 7x7 joint histogram of cloud fraction, partitioned by cloud-top pressure (CTP) and cloud optical depth (COT). This parameter alone is an important metric for comparing the simulation of clouds across models, given the differences between the MODIS and ISCCP instrument simulators (summarized in [Pincus et al 2012](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjournals.ametsoc.org%2Fview%2Fjournals%2Fclim%2F25%2F13%2Fjcli-d-11-00267.1.xml&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864920723%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ATWFk2FgzgikZKn86KzeC6sZWzk1P7qICZos2SW4bbU%3D&reserved=0)). Furthermore, it is an important supplement to _clmodisice _and _clmodisliquid_, as it can be used to decompose forcing from liquid- and ice-clouds into their "true" components by accounting for obscuration effects (ie, removing the component of aerosol forcing from liquid clouds that comes from changes in overlying ice clouds, rather than changes from the liquid clouds themselves). Furthermore, this metric can be used as output in historical simulations to compare MODIS simulator output from a GCM to MODIS observations to evaluate model performance (as in [Klein 2013,](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fagupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com%2Fdoi%2Ffull%2F10.1002%2Fjgrd.50141&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864934620%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=lYOP6ftNOiR%2B64ObT5%2BGRCyd26gOnT%2BxegT2HM3lKT8%3D&reserved=0) but using the MODIS simulator).

title: Modis Cloud Area Fraction

review.atmosphere-review-comments: Atmosphere team are happy with the technical description of the parameters and confirmed there is precedent for the modis naming convention. The IPO has reached out to the proposer to inform that an accepted physical parameter does not indicate inclusion into the Data Request - the physical parameter must be assigned to a Variable, which in turn must be assigned a variable group and opportunity to ensure inclusion.
